intro: Calathiana terglouensis, commonly known as the Terglou's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, often blue or violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to survive in harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, helping to conserve water. Calathiana terglouensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
